content: laid back lace wrap by susan kennedy of prettypeaceful http //www prettypeaceful etsy com http //www ravelry com/designers/susan-e-kennedy yarn any dk weight yarn will work for this project this is a weight category 3 yarn the wrap pictured was made with lion brand mandala yarn in griffin the pattern requires 1 cake of mandala mandala baby or cupcake yarn 590 yards 540 m finished wrap size 66 by 20 inches 168 x 51 cm with the recommended yarn and hook size after wet blocking see tutorial section for instructions for blocking laid back lace wrap crochet pattern yarn weight dk weight category 3 hook size 11 5 mm us p size gauge 8 single_crochet stitches = 4 inches 10 cm 10 row = 4 inches 10 cm before blocking terms chain yarn over and pull through loop on hook single_crochet single_crochet us insert hook into stitch yarn over pull through stitch yarn over and pull through both loops on hook row 1 chain 109 single_crochet in 2nd loop from hook and in each chain across 108 stitches row 2-48 chain 1 does not count as a stitch single_crochet in each stitch across turn 108 stitches fasten_off and weave in the ends blocking tutorial to open up the lace and even out your stitches wet block your wrap it will look something like this before blocking 1 soak your wrap in warm water in a tub or sink for 3-5 minutes let the sink or tub drain and gently squeeze the excess water from your wrap do not twist 2 lay the wrap on a towel roll the wrap up in the towel and gently press out the water with your hands or feet 2 3 lay the wrap flat on a foam mat yoga mat bed dry towel or plastic wrap taped over carpet smooth the wrap out into an even 66- by 20-inch rectangle 166 by 51 cm pin in place leave to dry overnight or until completely dry an advanced option for a more professional look begin row 1 with 108 foundation single_crochet stitches instead of chains foundation crochet is a method for beginning a project without having to make a separate row of chains first for a tutorial on foundation crochet visit tamara kelly s lovely blog moogly at http //www mooglyblog com/foundation- single-crochet-fsc/ and http //www mooglyblog com/foundation-double-crochet-fdc/
